A dissertation is not the same as 'new research'. It just means writing a long paper on a certain topic.

Research is most definitely required. STEM research looks different than research for a liberal_arts PhD, but both are research.

 on an opinion you hope to support

If your dissertation was an opinion you only hope to support you're not going to have a good time of it. You better have an observation with explicit proof to back it up.

You don't need a fellowship to get paid for a science major

I don't know how it works for science, but for engineering if you want a stipend, you need a fellowship. Also, all the PhD programs I looked at(for liberal_arts) gave everyone they accepted fellowship, you didn't need to try to secure it. Getting into the school was work enough.

Here it is you that is being disingenuous.

Sorry, I didn't remember exactly what you said, it was a couple months ago. I just remember you saying something to the effect that poor people make poor decisions(about money) and that money had a big impact on relationships, and it rubbed me the wrong way. To *me* it came across as "if he[.] poor or bad with money the relationship[.] doomed", although I accept that I probably misinterpreted it.

Also, while it may be more likely for a lower class person to be bad with money, I wouldn't be extra careful around them because there[.] no guarantee they're going to be bad with money or that a middle/upper class person won't be worse. Of course this is a typical RP vs. BP disagreement: you look at trends and I assess individuals.
